{"step_by_step_thinking": "Maturity onset diabetes of the young (MODY) is a monogenic form of diabetes characterized by mutations in multiple genes. The most common form of MODY is MODY2, which is caused by mutations in the glucokinase (GCK) gene. Therefore, the genetic mutation seen in the most common type of MODY is in the GCK gene.", "answer_choice": "C"}
